result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Christopher S Kroening was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court
Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Credit for 4 days only if revoked.
On driver's license and any vehicle titled in his name commencing upon issuance of valid DL.

miscConds.notes: To be paid within the first year of probation.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.

The defendant must submit a DNA sample with surcharge assessed.

The defendant must pay $500.00 for his court appointed attorney costs within the next 30 days and remainder will be due thru probation.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA meeting per week and submit proof of attendance to P&P agent.

timeConds.notes: Huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - no objection to serving the sentence/probation in another county but it is the ultimate decision of the Sheriff(s)/P&P agent.
To be completed within the first year of probation.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay outstanding fines at the rate of no less than $300.00/month.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher S Kroening

records.addlTxt: for civil judgment requested by DOC

Defendant Christopher S Kroening in court with attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  Defendant Christopher S Kroening in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:29 AM. State - here for revocation hearing, defendant is on loan from Sheboygan County Jail. Svehlek and State have revocation summary as does the defendant. Svehlek - believes there may have been an error in regards to a date but will inform the Court if she finds that. State - informs Court that the State and the Court received a letter that was filed by Svehlek for the defendant - makes argument for sentencing prior to his recommendation - 310 days credit - recommends 18 months in WI State Prison System with no ES (roughly 8 months left to serve). Court asks about bifurcation of the sentence as it is a prison recommendation. State recommends 2 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 18 months of initial incarceration followed by 6 months of ES. Svehlek informs Court of incorrect date. Svehlek makes sentencing argument prior to sentencing - recommends 1 year in the county jail with credit for 310 days, if the Court orders a prison sentence - asks that he be found eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Kroening withholds comment. Court puts on the record that it has reviewed the letter filed by the defendant in regards to today's hearing - questions if the defendant is eligible for SPD - asks questions about why the defendant has not paid anything on the fines. Kroening responds. Court asks for clarification of the 310 days that the State came up with for credit. State responds. Court came up with less time, reviews it, does come up with the same amount as the State of 310 days credit. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 2 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 1 year of initial confinement followed by 1 year of ES, eligible for any programs available, credit for 310 days (stipulated), pay the outstanding fines at the rate of no less than $300.00/month as a condition of ES, right to appeal, adjourned.
Letter from court to attorney regarding ex parte communications.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 11, 2018 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Christopher S Kroening in court with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:25 PM. Drewa - resolved - provides court with plea questionnaire. State - pleading to count #1 of Information and dismiss count #2 - 3 years probation with conditions of: 9 months in FC jail, $2985.00 fine inclusive of cost, 3 year DL revocation, acknowledge 4 prior convictions, AODA, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, leaves employment issue up to Court. Drewa and Kroening agree. Drewa - asks if probation/jail be transferred if work becomes available in another county. Court dismisses count #2. Kroening pleads G to count #1 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Drewa makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Kroening makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: 9 months in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03()3) - credit for 4 days only if revoked - report today - no objection to serving the sentence/probation in another county but it is the ultimate decision of the Sheriff (s) and DOC, AODA and follow thru, no consumption of possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars/taverns, $2985.00 fine - inclusive of costs - paid within first year of probation, 3 year DL revocation, IID for 3 years on DL and all vehicles titled in his name commencing upon issuance of valid DL, pay $500 towards attorney fees within the next 30 days and remainder due thru , maintain/obtain full time employment, attend at least one AA meeting per week and provide proof of attendance to P&P agent, 100 hours of community service - to be completed within the first year of probation, voting rights, no possession of firearms, submit DNA sample - due thru probation, right to appeal, adjourned.

Defendant Christopher S Kroening in court with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:14 p.m. State - with intet of PH being waived, has filed Information (mirrors). Court goes over waiver of PH and finds freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to trial, finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Proceed to ARGN. Drewa enters NG plea. Court accepts plea and sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing
Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Attorney Timothy Drewa in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Christopher Kroening does not appear. Called at 10:28 AM. Drewa has attempted to contact the defendant with the phone number provided to him (715-889-9343). Court makes statement in regards to notice to defendant, noticed in court. State - requests warrant. Court - issues bench warrant, body or $2000.00. Court will also appoint Tim Drewa for the refusal matter that is scheduled for this afternoon. Recalled at 2:26 PM. Drewa explains why the defendant was not here, asks that the Court quash the warrant for stated reasons. Court questions defendant on his non-appearance from this AM. Defendant explains why he was not here this AM. Court will quash the warrant this time but warns of any more non-appearances. Drewa has complaint, waives reading of it, requests PH but will waive time limits for it. Court sets for PH on 6/1/15 at 3:00 PM. Court continues bond at this point.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Christopher S Kroening in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:37 PM. Also called 15TR214. Court asks defendant where his attorney is. Defendant informs Court that he didn't get released from incarceration until Friday and would like either a court appointed attorney or SPD, given court appointed paperwork. Recess to talk to SPD (2:37 PM). Recalled at 2:49 PM. Defendant does not qualify for SPD appointed, has completed the court appointed attorney paperwork. Court has reviewed the financial disclosure, appoints an attorney and must repay at the rate or $400.00/month commencing 6/1/15/CO, instructs on ramifications of not making payments. Court sets refusal matter for 5/6/15 at 3:45 PM and will set this matter for FPT on same date and at 10:15 am, continues bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 10:15 am.
No consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.

Defendant Christopher S Kroening in court, in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:17 AM. Kroening has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Kroening understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, cannot afford his own. Court refers to SPD, continues bond, set for AIA. Kroening asks for signature bond. State - bond - $500 cash bond. Court - $3000 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, call SPD today.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
in Support of Search Warrant - Forced Blood Draw
No consumption of alcohol. No entry into bars or taverns.
